Events.text: Servius Tullius, king of Rome, celebrates a triumph for his victory over the Etruscans.
Events.html: Servius Tullius, king of Rome, celebrates a triumph for his victory over the Etruscans.

Events.text: Siege of Paris: Viking forces sail the Seine River with a fleet of 300 longships and lay siege to Paris.
Events.html: Siege of Paris: Viking forces sail the Seine River with a fleet of 300 longships and lay siege to Paris.

Events.text: Máel Coluim mac Cináeda, King of Scots, dies. His grandson, Donnchad, son of Bethóc and Crínán of Dunkeld, inherits the throne.
Events.html: Máel Coluim mac Cináeda, King of Scots, dies. His grandson, Donnchad, son of Bethóc and Crínán of Dunkeld, inherits the throne.

Events.text: The White Ship sinks in the English Channel, drowning William Adelin, son and heir of Henry I of England.
Events.html: The White Ship sinks in the English Channel, drowning William Adelin, son and heir of Henry I of England.

Events.text: Baldwin IV of Jerusalem and Raynald of Châtillon defeat Saladin at the Battle of Montgisard.
Events.html: Baldwin IV of Jerusalem and Raynald of Châtillon defeat Saladin at the Battle of Montgisard.

Events.text: A tsunami, caused by an earthquake in the Tyrrhenian Sea, devastates Naples and the Maritime Republic of Amalfi, among other places.
Events.html: A tsunami, caused by an earthquake in the Tyrrhenian Sea, devastates Naples and the Maritime Republic of Amalfi, among other places.

Events.text: Elizabeth of York is crowned Queen of England.
Events.html: Elizabeth of York is crowned Queen of England.

Events.text: The siege of Granada, the last Moorish stronghold in Spain, ends with the Treaty of Granada.
Events.html: The siege of Granada, the last Moorish stronghold in Spain, ends with the Treaty of Granada.

Events.text: A deadly earthquake rocks Shemakha in the Caucasus, killing 80,000 people.
Events.html: A deadly earthquake rocks Shemakha in the Caucasus, killing 80,000 people.

Events.text: King Ferdinand VI of Spain grants royal protection to the Beaterio de la Compañia de Jesus, now known as the Congregation of the Religious of the Virgin Mary.
Events.html: King Ferdinand VI of Spain grants royal protection to the Beaterio de la Compañia de Jesus, now known as the Congregation of the Religious of the Virgin Mary.

Events.text: French and Indian War: British forces capture Fort Duquesne from French control. Later, Fort Pitt will be built nearby and grow into modern Pittsburgh.
Events.html: French and Indian War: British forces capture Fort Duquesne from French control. Later, Fort Pitt will be built nearby and grow into modern Pittsburgh.

Events.text: An earthquake hits the Mediterranean destroying Beirut and Damascus and killing 30,000-40,000.
Events.html: An earthquake hits the Mediterranean destroying Beirut and Damascus and killing 30,000-40,000.

Events.text: American Revolutionary War: The last British troops leave New York City three months after the signing of the Treaty of Paris.
Events.html: American Revolutionary War: The last British troops leave New York City three months after the signing of the Treaty of Paris.

Events.text: Partitions of Poland: Stanisław August Poniatowski, the last king of independent Poland, is forced to abdicate and is exiled to Russia.
Events.html: Partitions of Poland: Stanisław August Poniatowski, the last king of independent Poland, is forced to abdicate and is exiled to Russia.

Events.text: The Greek frigate Hellas arrives in Nafplion to become the first flagship of the Hellenic Navy.
Events.html: The Greek frigate Hellas arrives in Nafplion to become the first flagship of the Hellenic Navy.

Events.text: A massive undersea earthquake, estimated magnitude between 8.7-9.2, rocks Sumatra, producing a massive tsunami all along the Indonesian coast.
Events.html: A massive undersea earthquake, estimated magnitude between 8.7-9.2, rocks Sumatra, producing a massive tsunami all along the Indonesian coast.

Events.text: A cyclone slams India with high winds and a 40-foot storm surge, destroying the port city of Coringa (which has never been completely rebuilt). The storm wave sweeps inland, taking with it 20,000 ships and thousands of people. An estimated 300,000 deaths result from the disaster.
Events.html: A cyclone slams India with high winds and a 40-foot storm surge, destroying the port city of Coringa (which has never been completely rebuilt). The storm wave sweeps inland, taking with it 20,000 ships and thousands of people. An estimated 300,000 deaths result from the disaster.

links.title: Pre-1980 North Indian Ocean cyclone seasons

Events.text: American Civil War: Battle of Missionary Ridge: At Missionary Ridge in Tennessee, Union forces led by General Ulysses S. Grant break the Siege of Chattanooga by routing Confederate troops under General Braxton Bragg.
Events.html: American Civil War: Battle of Missionary Ridge: At Missionary Ridge in Tennessee, Union forces led by General Ulysses S. Grant break the Siege of Chattanooga by routing Confederate troops under General Braxton Bragg.

Events.text: American Civil War: A group of Confederate operatives calling themselves the Confederate Army of Manhattan starts fires in more than 20 locations in an unsuccessful attempt to burn down New York City.
Events.html: American Civil War: A group of Confederate operatives calling themselves the Confederate Army of Manhattan starts fires in more than 20 locations in an unsuccessful attempt to burn down New York City.

Events.text: The United States Greenback Party is established as a political party consisting primarily of farmers affected by the Panic of 1873.
Events.html: The United States Greenback Party is established as a political party consisting primarily of farmers affected by the Panic of 1873.

Events.text: American Indian Wars: In retaliation for the American defeat at the Battle of the Little Bighorn, United States Army troops sack the sleeping village of Cheyenne Chief Dull Knife at the headwaters of the Powder River.
Events.html: American Indian Wars: In retaliation for the American defeat at the Battle of the Little Bighorn, United States Army troops sack the sleeping village of Cheyenne Chief Dull Knife at the headwaters of the Powder River.

Events.text: Prince Carl of Denmark arrives in Norway to become King Haakon VII of Norway.
Events.html: Prince Carl of Denmark arrives in Norway to become King Haakon VII of Norway.

Events.text: Albert Einstein presents the field equations of general relativity to the Prussian Academy of Sciences.
Events.html: Albert Einstein presents the field equations of general relativity to the Prussian Academy of Sciences.

Events.text: World War I: German forces defeat Portuguese army of about 1200 at Negomano on the border of modern-day Mozambique and Tanzania.
Events.html: World War I: German forces defeat Portuguese army of about 1200 at Negomano on the border of modern-day Mozambique and Tanzania.

Events.text: Vojvodina, formerly Austro-Hungarian crown land, proclaims its secession from Austria–Hungary to join the Kingdom of Serbia.
Events.html: Vojvodina, formerly Austro-Hungarian crown land, proclaims its secession from Austria–Hungary to join the Kingdom of Serbia.

Events.text: The deadliest November tornado outbreak in U.S. history kills 76 people and injures more than 400.
Events.html: The deadliest November tornado outbreak in U.S. history kills 76 people and injures more than 400.

links.title: List of North American tornadoes and tornado outbreaks

Events.text: In Berlin, Germany and Japan sign the Anti-Comintern Pact, agreeing to consult on measures "to safeguard their common interests" in the case of an unprovoked attack by the Soviet Union against either nation. The pact is renewed on the same day five years later with additional signatories.
Events.html: In Berlin, Germany and Japan sign the Anti-Comintern Pact, agreeing to consult on measures "to safeguard their common interests" in the case of an unprovoked attack by the Soviet Union against either nation. The pact is renewed on the same day five years later with additional signatories.

Events.text: World War II: First flight of the de Havilland Mosquito and Martin B-26 Marauder.
Events.html: World War II: First flight of the de Havilland Mosquito and Martin B-26 Marauder.

Events.text: HMS Barham is sunk by a German torpedo during World War II.
Events.html: HMS Barham is sunk by a German torpedo during World War II.

Events.text: World War II: Statehood of Bosnia and Herzegovina is re-established at the State Anti-fascist Council for the National Liberation of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Events.html: World War II: Statehood of Bosnia and Herzegovina is re-established at the State Anti-fascist Council for the National Liberation of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

links.title: State Anti-fascist Council for the National Liberation of Bosnia and Herzegovina

Events.text: Red Scare: The "Hollywood Ten" are blacklisted by Hollywood movie studios.
Events.html: Red Scare: The "Hollywood Ten" are blacklisted by Hollywood movie studios.

Events.text: New Zealand ratifies the Statute of Westminster and thus becomes independent of legislative control by the United Kingdom.
Events.html: 1947 – New Zealand ratifies the Statute of Westminster and thus becomes independent of legislative control by the United Kingdom.

Events.text: The Great Appalachian Storm of November 1950 impacts 22 American states, killing 353 people, injuring over 160, and causing US$66.7 million in damages (1950 dollars).
Events.html: The Great Appalachian Storm of November 1950 impacts 22 American states, killing 353 people, injuring over 160, and causing US$66.7 million in damages (1950 dollars).

Events.text: Agatha Christie's murder-mystery play The Mousetrap opens at the Ambassadors Theatre in London. It will become the longest continuously-running play in history.
Events.html: Agatha Christie's murder-mystery play The Mousetrap opens at the Ambassadors Theatre in London. It will become the longest continuously-running play in history.

Events.text: Korean War: After 42 days of fighting, the Battle of Triangle Hill ends with Chinese victory, American and South Korean units abandon their attempt to capture the "Iron Triangle".
Events.html: 1952 – Korean War: After 42 days of fighting, the Battle of Triangle Hill ends with Chinese victory, American and South Korean units abandon their attempt to capture the "Iron Triangle".

Events.text: French Sudan gains autonomy as a self-governing member of the French Community.
Events.html: French Sudan gains autonomy as a self-governing member of the French Community.

Events.text: The Mirabal sisters of the Dominican Republic are assassinated.
Events.html: The Mirabal sisters of the Dominican Republic are assassinated.

Events.text: President Kennedy is buried in Washington D.C..
Events.html: President Kennedy is buried in Washington D.C..

Events.text: Lee Harvey Oswald is buried in Fort Worth, TX.
Events.html: 1963 – Lee Harvey Oswald is buried in Fort Worth, TX.

Events.text: First television link between Australia and the UK.
Events.html: First television link between Australia and the UK.

Events.text: In Japan, author Yukio Mishima and one compatriot commit ritualistic seppuku after an unsuccessful coup attempt.
Events.html: In Japan, author Yukio Mishima and one compatriot commit ritualistic seppuku after an unsuccessful coup attempt.

Events.text: Georgios Papadopoulos, head of the military Regime of the Colonels in Greece, is ousted in a hardliners' coup led by Brigadier General Dimitrios Ioannidis.
Events.html: Georgios Papadopoulos, head of the military Regime of the Colonels in Greece, is ousted in a hardliners' coup led by Brigadier General Dimitrios Ioannidis.

Events.text: Suriname gains independence from the Netherlands.
Events.html: Suriname gains independence from the Netherlands.

Events.text: Former Senator Benigno Aquino, Jr., is found guilty by the Philippine Military Commission No. 2 and is sentenced to death by firing squad. He is later assassinated in 1983.
Events.html: Former Senator Benigno Aquino, Jr., is found guilty by the Philippine Military Commission No. 2 and is sentenced to death by firing squad. He is later assassinated in 1983.

Events.text: Pope John Paul II appoints Joseph Cardinal Ratzinger (the future Pope Benedict XVI) Prefect of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith.
Events.html: Pope John Paul II appoints Joseph Cardinal Ratzinger (the future Pope Benedict XVI) Prefect of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith.

links.title: Prefect of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith

Events.text: Thirty-six top musicians gather in a Notting Hill studio and record Band Aid's "Do They Know It's Christmas?" in order to raise money for famine relief in Ethiopia.
Events.html: Thirty-six top musicians gather in a Notting Hill studio and record Band Aid's "Do They Know It's Christmas?" in order to raise money for famine relief in Ethiopia.

Events.text: Iran–Contra affair: U.S. Attorney General Edwin Meese announces that profits from covert weapons sales to Iran were illegally diverted to the anti-communist Contra rebels in Nicaragua.
Events.html: Iran–Contra affair: U.S. Attorney General Edwin Meese announces that profits from covert weapons sales to Iran were illegally diverted to the anti-communist Contra rebels in Nicaragua.

Events.text: The King Fahd Causeway is officially opened in the Persian Gulf.
Events.html: 1986 – The King Fahd Causeway is officially opened in the Persian Gulf.

Events.text: Typhoon Nina pummels the Philippines with category 5 winds of 165 mph and a surge that destroys entire villages. At least 1,036 deaths are attributed to the storm.
Events.html: Typhoon Nina pummels the Philippines with category 5 winds of 165 mph and a surge that destroys entire villages. At least 1,036 deaths are attributed to the storm.

Events.text: The Federal Assembly of Czechoslovakia votes to split the country into the Czech Republic and Slovakia, with effect from January 1, 1993.
Events.html: The Federal Assembly of Czechoslovakia votes to split the country into the Czech Republic and Slovakia, with effect from January 1, 1993.

Events.text: An ice storm strikes the central U.S., killing 26 people. A powerful windstorm affects Florida and winds gust over 90 mph, toppling trees and flipping trailers.
Events.html: An ice storm strikes the central U.S., killing 26 people. A powerful windstorm affects Florida and winds gust over 90 mph, toppling trees and flipping trailers.

Events.text: A 5-year-old Cuban boy, Elian Gonzalez, is rescued by fishermen while floating in an inner tube off the Florida coast.
Events.html: A 5-year-old Cuban boy, Elian Gonzalez, is rescued by fishermen while floating in an inner tube off the Florida coast.

Events.text: The 2000 Baku earthquake, with a Richter magnitude of 7.0, leaves 26 people dead in Baku, Azerbaijan, and becomes the strongest earthquake in the region in 158 years.
Events.html: The 2000 Baku earthquake, with a Richter magnitude of 7.0, leaves 26 people dead in Baku, Azerbaijan, and becomes the strongest earthquake in the region in 158 years.

Events.text: Cyclone Nisha strikes northern Sri Lanka, killing 15 people and displacing 90,000 others while dealing the region the highest rainfall in nine decades.
Events.html: Cyclone Nisha strikes northern Sri Lanka, killing 15 people and displacing 90,000 others while dealing the region the highest rainfall in nine decades.

Events.text: Jeddah floods: Freak rains swamp the city of Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, during an ongoing Hajj pilgrimage. Three thousand cars are swept away and 122 people perish in the torrents, with 350 others missing.
Events.html: Jeddah floods: Freak rains swamp the city of Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, during an ongoing Hajj pilgrimage. Three thousand cars are swept away and 122 people perish in the torrents, with 350 others missing.

Events.text: Pope Francis makes his first official visit to Africa.
Events.html: Pope Francis makes his first official visit to Africa.
